Hoppin' John

Ingredients needed: 1 10- ounces package frozen black-eyed peas, 1/8 teaspoon cayenne, 3 cups canned low-sodium chicken broth or homemade stock, 1/2 pound collard greens, tough stems removed, leaves washed well and shredded, 1/2 pound kielbasa or other smoked sausage, halved lengthwise then cut crosswise into 1-inch slices, 1 onion, chopped, 1 1/2 cups long-grain rice, 4 scallions, white bulbs sliced and green tops cut into 1/2-inch pieces,
Diets supported: gluten free, dairy free,
  • 1: Bring all ingredients except rice to boil in Dutch oven, stirring occasionally.
  • 2: Stir in rice; cover. Simmer 10 min. or until tender.
  • 1: (Soak black-eyed peas in cool water for at least 6 hours. Rinse before using.)
  • 2: Heat butter in a large pot over medium-high heat.
  • 3: Add onion, garlic, green pepper, and celery and stir. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in soaked beans, then add chicken broth, ham hock, salt & pepper, and cayenne to taste. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and cover the pot for 30 minutes. After 30 minutes, check the liquid level; if it's too soupy, cook with the lid off for another 15 minutes or so. If it's too thick, splash in a little more broth. Stir in vinegar, then taste for seasonings.
  • 4: Add more spice if needed.
  • 5: Serve over white or brown rice, making sure to get plenty of the cooking liquid spooned over the top. Or, you may mix the bean mixture with the rice before serving. Variations: add red bell pepper, canned diced tomatoes, diced jalapenos, diced ham (instead of ham hocks), or sliced bacon (instead of ham hocks). Stir in torn-up kale when 5 minutes of cooking time remain. Variation: use canned, drained black-eyed peas if preferred. Just use diced ham instead of ham hock and a little less broth, as peas won't need to cook as long.
  • 1: In a large saucepan or Dutch oven, heat the oil over moderately low heat.
  • 2: Add the onion and the scallion bulbs and cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.
  • 3: Add the collard greens, salt, black pepper, and cayenne and cook, stirring, until the greens wilt, about 1 minute.
  • 4: Increase the heat to moderately high.
  • 5: Add the sausage, black-eyed peas, and rice and cook, stirring, for 30 seconds. Stir in the broth and bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat to low and cook, covered, until the rice is tender and all the liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes.
  • 6: Remove from the heat and stir in the scallion tops.
  • 7: Wine Recommendation: The robust flavors of Hoppin' John call for an equally assertive wine. Go for a brash, full-bodied red zinfandel from California. Its spicy blackberry richness is easily up to the task.
  • 8: Notes: Collard greens braised to melting softness in the Southern style (slow-simmered with plenty of pork) are truly delicious, but the greens don't actually have to cook for hours. In twenty minutes they'll be just tender.

Lime & ginger salmon

Ingredients needed: juice 2 limes, thumb-sized piece ginger, grated, 2 garlic cloves, crushed, 2 tbsp rice wine vinegar, 2 skinless salmon fillets, 100ml low-sodium chicken stock, 140g pack baby corn, halved, 175g thin-stemmed broccoli, 4 baby pak choi, halved, small bunch spring onions, sliced,
Diets supported: gluten free, dairy free, pescatarian,
  • 1: Mix the lime juice, ginger, garlic, soy and vinegar with some black pepper.
  • 2: Pour half over the salmon fillets and leave to marinate for 10 mins.
  • 3: Heat the grill to High. Lay the salmon on a non-stick baking tray and grill for 5-6 mins each side or until cooked through. Meanwhile, heat a wok with the remaining marinade and the stock, add the baby corn and broccoli, stir-fry for about 5 mins, then add the pak choi and cook for 2 mins more.
  • 4: Serve the salmon on top of the vegetables with any sauce from the pan and sprinkle with the spring onions.

Ham, Potato and Leek Soup

Ingredients needed: 2 Tbsp unsalted butter, 1 large or 2 small leeks to make 4 cups thinly sliced leeks, white and light green parts only (see How to Clean Leeks), 4 cups chicken broth, 2 large russet potatoes (about 1 pound), peeled, cut into 1/2 inch pieces, 2 cups ham, diced, 1/4 to 1/2 cup cream, half and half, or chicken stock, 3 Tbsp fresh parsley, chives or dill, chopped,
Diets supported: gluten free,
  • 1: Cook leeks in butter: Melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat.
  • 2: Add the leeks and cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes, or until leeks are soft but not browned.

Fiesta Chowder

Ingredients needed: 1 (15-ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained, 1 (4.5-ounce) can chopped green chiles, 1 (14 1/2-ounce) can Mexican-style stewed tomatoes, 1 (10 3/4-ounce) can condensed nacho cheese soup, 4 skinned and boned chicken breast halves, cubed, Garnish: chopped fresh cilantro, 3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro, 1 teaspoon minced garlic, 1 cup uncooked instant brown rice, 1 tablespoon lime juice, 1 medium onion, chopped, 1 (1.4-ounce) package fajita seasoning, divided, 1 (15 1/4-ounce) can whole kernel corn with red and green peppers, drained,
Diets supported: dairy free,
  • 1: Combine flour and 2 tablespoons fajita seasoning in a heavy-duty zip-top plastic bag; add chicken. Seal and shake to coat.
  • 2: Cook chicken in hot oil in a large Dutch oven over high heat, stirring often, 4 minutes or until browned. Reduce heat to medium-high; add onion and garlic; saut 5 minutes. Stir in remaining fajita seasoning, corn, next 5 ingredients, and, if desired, olives. Bring mixture to a boil; reduce heat to medium-low, cover and simmer 5 minutes.
  • 3: Remove lid, and stir in nacho cheese soup, chopped cilantro, and lime juice.
  • 4: Garnish, if desired, and serve with breadsticks, if desired.

Salami, Bacon and Spinach Hash

Ingredients needed: 8 ounces apple-smoked bacon (5 to 6 slices), cut into 1/2-inch pieces, 3 cups baby spinach leaves, 4 large eggs, at room temperature, 1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg, 1 medium onion, chopped, Zest of 1/2 medium orange, 1 red bell pepper, cored, seeded and cut into 1/2-inch pieces, 2 medium russet potatoes (about 1 1/2 pounds), peeled and chopped into 1-inch cubes, 5 ounces dry salami, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch cubes,
Diets supported: gluten free, dairy free, whole 30,
  • 1: Watch how to make this recipe.
  • 2: Cook the bacon over medium-high heat in a 12-inch nonstick skillet, stirring occasionally, until crisp, 10 to 12 minutes.
  • 3: Remove the bacon using a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.
  • 4: Add the potatoes, 1 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper to the pan juices. Cook, stirring frequently, until brown and crisp, about 25 minutes.
  • 5: Remove the potatoes using a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.
  • 6: Add the oil, onion, bell pepper, 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are soft, about 5 minutes.
  • 7: Add the spinach, salami, nutmeg, orange zest, the remaining 1/4 teaspoon of salt and pepper. Cook until the spinach is wilted, about 4 minutes. Stir in the bacon and potatoes.
  • 8: Make 4 indentations in the hash and break an egg into each. Cook until the eggs are cooked through, 5 to 6 minutes.

Ham, Swiss and Apple Wraps

Ingredients needed: 1 apple, thinly sliced, 2 tablespoons chopped fresh dill or parsley, 4 ounces sliced lean ham (preferably low-sodium), torn into bite-size pieces, 2 tablespoons honey mustard, 1/3 cup low-fat plain yogurt, 1/2 red onion, thinly sliced, 1 romaine lettuce heart, torn into bite-size pieces, 3 cups strawberries, halved, 3 ounces sliced Swiss cheese, cut into strips, 4 whole-wheat wraps or tortillas,
Diets supported:
  • 1: Soak the red onion in a bowl of ice water, 10 minutes.
  • 2: Drain the onion and squeeze dry.
  • 3: Whisk the yogurt, dill, honey mustard, and salt and pepper to taste in a large bowl. Slowly drizzle in the olive oil and 1 tablespoon water, whisking until combined.
  • 4: Add the onion, ham, cheese, lettuce and apple and toss to coat. Pile the ham mixture in the middle of each wrap. Fold in the sides, then roll up the wraps.
  • 5: Cut in half and serve with the strawberries.
  • 6: Photograph by Antonis Achilleos

Cat Cake

Ingredients needed: 1/8 teaspoon almond extract, 1 package (8 ounces) cream cheese, softened, 2 pieces shoestring black licorice, about 2 inches long, 1 large pink candy heart, 1 jar (7 ounces) marshmallow creme, 3 brown milk chocolate M&M's, 2 ounces semisweet chocolate, melted and cooled, 4 individual cream-filled sponge cakes, 1 carton (8 ounces) frozen whipped topping, thawed, 1 package yellow cake mix (regular size),
Diets supported:
  • 1: Prepare cake batter according to package directions. Grease and flour a 3-cup and 2-qt. ovenproof bowls.
  • 2: Pour 1 cup of batter into the 3-cup bowl and remaining batter into the 2-qt. bowl.
  • 3: Bake small cake at 350° for 30-35 minutes and large cake for 40-45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool each cake for 10 minutes before removing from bowl to wire rack to cool completely.
  • 4: For frosting, in a large bowl, beat cream cheese until fluffy.
  • 5: Add marshmallow creme and almond extract; beat until smooth. Beat in whipped topping. Set aside 1/2 cup. In a small bowl, beat melted chocolate and remaining whipped topping mixture until smooth; set aside.
  • 6: Place cakes domed side up on an 18-in. x 12-in. covered board.
  • 7: Cut one creamed-filled sponge cake in half widthwise; place halves in front of large cake for front paws.
  • 8: Cut ends off another sponge cake; trim ends to form triangles. Set triangles aside for ears.
  • 9: Arrange the remaining sponge cakes behind large cake to form the tail. Frost cat's face and ears with reserved white frosting. Frost rest of cat with chocolate frosting.
  • 10: Place the ears on head. Arrange M&M's, licorice and candy heart to form the face.

Black Bean Soup

Ingredients needed: 2 cans (15 ounces each) black beans, rinsed and drained, 3/4 cup chopped celery, 3 cans (14-1/2 ounces each) chicken broth, 1 cup cubed cooked chicken breast, 1 cup cooked long grain rice, 3 garlic cloves, minced, 1 teaspoon ground cumin, 1 tablespoon lime juice, 1 medium onion, chopped, 1 jar (16 ounces) salsa,
Diets supported: gluten free, dairy free,

Diets supported: gluten free,

Fiesta Rice

Ingredients needed: 1 1/2 cups uncooked brown rice, 1 Tablespoon butter, 1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained, 1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes with chiles, undrained, 1/2 cup freshly chopped cilantro, 1 (10 ounce) package frozen whole kernel corn, thawed, 2 cups fat-free, less-sodium chicken broth, 1 teaspoon minced garlic, 1 cup chopped green onions, 1 teaspoon ground cumin, 1 Tablespoon fresh lime juice,
Diets supported: gluten free, lacto ovo vegetarian,
  • 1: Heat oil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat.
  • 2: Add corn to pan; cook 10 minutes or until corn starts to brown, stirring occasionally.
  • 3: Remove from pan. Set aside.
  • 4: Melt butter in pan.
  • 5: Add onions; saut 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in rice, cumin, and garlic; cook 1 minute.
  • 6: Add chicken broth, black pepper, salt, and diced tomatoes to pan; bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer for 45 minutes, stirring occasionally.
  • 7: Remove from heat; stir in reserved corn and beans. Cover and let stand 10 minutes. Stir in cilantro and juice.

Chicken, Leek and Pea Pie

Ingredients needed: 80 gm bacon, diced, 250 gm chicken breast (or chicken thigh), 200 ml chicken stock, 2½ Tbsp cream, 1 egg yolk, 50 gm corn kernels, fresh or frozen, 2 tsp minced garlic, 100 gm green peas, fresh or frozen, 1 leek, white and light green part, finely diced, 1 Tbsp milk, 2 Tbsp parsley, chopped, 125 ml sour cream, 200 gm unsalted butter, cold and coarsely chopped, 1½ Tbsp white wine,

White Chili

Ingredients needed: 1 small bell pepper, chopped, 1 stalk celery, thinly sliced, 2 cups chicken broth, 2 Tablespoons cilantro, chopped, 1 -2 cups cooked rice, 1 cup of corn, 1 teaspoon cornstarch, 2 cloves of garlic, minced, 1 teaspoon ground cumin, juice and zest of 2 limes - 1/4 cup, 1 small onion, chopped, 1 teaspoon oregano, ½ pound pork roast or chicken, cooked and shredded, 3½ cups cooked white beans or 2 - 15 oz. cans of white beans, undrained,

  • 1: In a large pot, brown onion, garlic, celery and bell pepper in the olive oil.In a small bowl, mix chicken broth and cornstarch, then add to the onions.Stir in all of the other ingredients.Cover; cook on low heat for 15 - 20 minutes.

Beans, tomato and raisins bruschetta

Ingredients needed: 1 baguette, sliced and slightly toasted, 3 cans (14 oz) butter or cannellini beans, rinsed and drained, 1 can (14 oz) diced tomatoes, 1 garlic clove, 1 onion, finely chopped, 1 cup California Raisins,
Diets supported: dairy free, lacto ovo vegetarian, vegan,
  • 1: Heat the oil in a large skillet over a medium flame.
  • 2: Add the chopped onion and cook until softened.
  • 3: Add the beans, diced tomatoes and raisins and cook for 5-10 minutes until the tomatoes are simmering and the beans are warmed through. Season with salt and pepper.
  • 4: Remove from the heat. Run the toasted baguette slices with the garlic clove and spoon some of the beans, tomato and raisins mixture over the slices.
  • 5: Drizzle with a little olive oil and sprinkle some freshly cracked black pepper (optional)
  • 6: Serve warm.

Crawfish Etouffee, Fried Catfish, Rice, Grilled Asparagus and Cornbread

Ingredients needed: 2 bunches asparagus, 2 teaspoons baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, 2 bay leaves, 1 cup buttermilk, 8 catfish fillets, 1 teaspoon cayenne, Cayenne, as needed, 3 stalks celery, diced, 1 teaspoon chili powder, 1 pound crawfish tails, 1 cup creamed corn, 2 large eggs, 3 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley, 1 teaspoon chopped fresh thyme, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 1 green bell pepper, diced, Louisiana-style hot sauce, as needed, 1 lemon, juiced, 1 teaspoon paprika, 2 cups seafood stock, Smoked paprika, as needed, 3 tablespoons tomato paste, 1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter, 1 cup white rice, 1 cup yellow cornmeal, 2 cups yellow cornmeal, 1 yellow onion, diced,
Diets supported: pescatarian,
  • 1: For the crawfish etouffee: First, you make a roux. In a Dutch oven, add the butter over medium-high heat and melt.
  • 2: Add the flour and whisk until combined and there are no lumps in the flour. Continue to stir with a wooden spoon until the butter and flour mixture browns to the color of a shopping bag, 10 to 15 minutes. Make sure to stir continuously and do not allow the mixture to burn. If you notice little black specks, discard the roux and start over.
  • 3: Once the roux is sufficiently dark, add the garlic, celery, onion and bell pepper and stir. Cook for 5 minutes, then add the seafood stock and bring to a simmer.
  • 4: Add the parsley, tomato paste, thyme, bay leaves and some cayenne, paprika, salt and pepper. Stir and continue to simmer for another 10 minutes.
  • 5: Add the crawfish tails and simmer for another 10 minutes.
  • 6: Taste for seasoning and adjust if necessary.
  • 7: Remove the bay leaves before serving.
  • 8: For the rice: Over medium-high heat, bring 2 cups of water to a boil with the salt.
  • 9: Add the rice and return to a boil with a lid. Reduce to a simmer, keep covered and simmer until the rice is fully cooked, about 20 minutes. Reserve for serving.
  • 10: For the cornbread: Put a 10- to 12-inch cast-iron skillet in the oven and preheat to 425 degrees F.
  • 11: In a mixing bowl, combine the cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, salt and baking soda. In another mixing bowl, combine the buttermilk, creamed corn and eggs and whisk until the eggs are broken apart.
  • 12: Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and whisk until everything is incorporated.
  • 13: Carefully remove the cast-iron skillet from the oven. Coat the inside with the canola oil, then pour the cornbread batter into the skillet.
  • 14: Place the skillet back in the oven and bake until the top is golden brown and the inside is cooked all the way through, about 20 minutes. Flip the cornbread upside-down onto a cutting board. Reserve for serving.
  • 15: For the fried catfish: In a shallow pan or baking dish, combine the cornmeal, cayenne, paprika, chili powder, salt and pepper and stir to evenly spread the spices throughout the cornmeal. Hit each side of each catfish fillet with a few drops of a Louisiana-style hot sauce and spread it around. Dredge the fillets in the cornmeal mixture, generously coating both sides with it.
  • 16: In a deep fryer with oil set to 375 degrees F (or a cast iron skillet with oil heated to 375 degrees F), fry the catfish in batches until golden brown, 4 to 5 minutes.
  • 17: Drain on a pan lined with paper towels.
  • 18: For the grilled asparagus: Prepare a grill or grill pan for medium heat.
  • 19: Cut the white woody ends off of the asparagus and discard.
  • 20: Put the asparagus in a shallow dish, drizzle with olive oil and toss with some salt and pepper. Grill for 3 to 5 minutes, then flip the asparagus to grill the other side for another 3 to 5 minutes.
  • 21: Transfer to a serving plate and toss with the lemon juice.
